data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn't move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Paras
data.flavorText: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.

data.name: Parasect
data.flavorText: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 120 damage.

attacks.name: Mushroom Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Pinsir
data.flavorText: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

attacks.name: Roof Fling
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your opponent's hand.

data.name: Surskit
data.flavorText: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its heads. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Dartrix
data.flavorText: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

attacks.name: Sharp Blade Quill
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

data.name: Masquerain
data.flavorText: Its wings and antennae don't cope well with moisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to dry off.

attacks.name: Struggle Bug
attacks.text: Move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Decidueye
data.flavorText: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Decidueye-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Feather Arrow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hollow Hunt-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Grubbin
data.flavorText: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.

data.name: Fomantis
data.flavorText: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Lurantis-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flower Supply
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Solar Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chloroscythe-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Morelull
data.flavorText: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Shiinotic
data.flavorText: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Steenee
data.flavorText: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Bounsweet
data.flavorText: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Tsareena
data.flavorText: Its long, striking legs aren't just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.

abilities.name: Queenly Majesty
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may have your opponent reveal their hand. Then, discard a card from it.

attacks.name: Trop Kick
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage and remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

data.name: Torkoal
data.flavorText: Coal is the source of Torkoal's energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mounts where they live.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: It's both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Firestorm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Incineroar
data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Darkest Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.name: Torracat
data.flavorText: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Incineroar-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hustling Strike
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Fire Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tiger Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Burning Slam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who posses one, so it was over-hunted in the past.

attacks.name: Double Jet
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Poliwag
data.flavorText: It's still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Poliwrath
data.flavorText: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wake-Up Slap
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

data.name: Poliwhirl
data.flavorText: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it's safe.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.

data.name: Cloyster
data.flavorText: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.

attacks.name: Headlock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Lapras-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Ice Beam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Corsola
data.flavorText: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Wingull
data.flavorText: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they're circling, the ocean sure to be is teeming with fish Pokémon.

attacks.name: Roost
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. It can't retreat during your next turn.

data.name: Pelipper
data.flavorText: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.

attacks.name: Courier
attacks.text: Put 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

data.name: Primarina
data.flavorText: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learning from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sparkling Aria
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Brionne
data.flavorText: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards it enemies.

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Crabominable
data.flavorText: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Wishiwashi
data.flavorText: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and return it to your hand. You can't use this Ability during your first turn or on the turn this Pokémon was put into play.

data.name: Primarina-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bubble Beat
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Roaring Seas
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grand Echo-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pyukumuku
data.flavorText: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.

abilities.name: Innards Out
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Araquanid
data.flavorText: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

abilities.name: Water Bubble
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

data.name: Bruxish
data.flavorText: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

attacks.name: Vivid Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Fangs
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Aqua Spark
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

attacks.name: Searching Light
attacks.text: Look at 1 of your face-down Prize cards.

data.name: Charjabug
data.flavorText: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

attacks.name: Shocking Jaws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Vikavolt
data.flavorText: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

abilities.name: Strong Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Energy card and a Lightning Energy card and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electro Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Togedemaru
data.flavorText: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Golbat
data.flavorText: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Crobat
data.flavorText: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it can't move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Surprise Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Alolan Grimer
data.flavorText: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Alolan Muk
data.flavorText: While it's unexpectedly quiet and friendly, if it's not fed any trash for a while, it will smash its Trainer's furnishings and eat up the fragments.

abilities.name: Power of Alchemy
abilities.text: Each Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Drowzee
data.flavorText: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it's ever eaten.

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Toxapex
data.flavorText: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.

abilities.name: Toxic Spikes
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, their new Active Pokémon is Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Mareanie
data.flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Espeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Divide-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cosmog
data.flavorText: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

attacks.name: Dust Gathering
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Lunala-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moongeist Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunar Fall-GX
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cosmoem
data.flavorText: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Makuhita
data.flavorText: It was originally brought in from another region, but now Makuhita from Alola are more famous.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Hariyama
data.flavorText: It is known for its fantastic strength, but as it grows older, it focuses more on training Makuhita.

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Roggenrola
data.flavorText: The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.

attacks.name: Smack Down
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Boldore
data.flavorText: It explores caves in search of underground water. It's not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Gigalith
data.flavorText: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.

attacks.name: Rock Artillery
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Fighting Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Crabrawler
data.flavorText: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.

data.name: Passimian
data.flavorText: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Team Play
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Passimian.

data.name: Sandygast
data.flavorText: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.

attacks.name: Shore Up
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Alolan Rattata
data.flavorText: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.

data.name: Alolan Meowth
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They're prideful and crafty.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Palossand
data.flavorText: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

abilities.name: Wall of Sand
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Absorb Vitality
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Raticate
data.flavorText: This gourmet Pokémon is particular about the taste and freshness of its food. Restaurants where Raticate live have a good reputation.

attacks.name: Evil Orders
attacks.text: Search your deck for a number of cards up to the number of your Benched Pokémon and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Alolan Persian
data.flavorText: Its round face and smooth coat—softer than the most high-class velvet—have made this a very popular Pokémon in Alola.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Umbreon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Call-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they rush to attack en masse. When alone, they're rather cowardly.

attacks.name: Gnaw Through
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Sharpedo
data.flavorText: It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin was a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokémon became a victim of overfishing.

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Krookodile
data.flavorText: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.

attacks.name: False Accusation
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Obsidian Fang
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Diglett
data.flavorText: Its head sports an altered form of whiskers made of metal. When in communication with its comrades, its whiskers wobble to and fro.

attacks.name: Spelunk
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

data.name: Skarmory
data.flavorText: Its feathers, which fall off as it grows, are thin and sharp. In times long past, warriors used them as swords.

attacks.name: Metallic Sound
attacks.text: Discard all Special Energy from each Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio
data.flavorText: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It's reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.

abilities.name: Tangling Hair
abilities.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Snubbull
data.flavorText: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Solgaleo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cutiefly
data.flavorText: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

attacks.name: Fly Around
attacks.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it's satisfied.

attacks.name: Dragon Wave
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy and a Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giant Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Kangaskhan
data.flavorText: Kangaskhan's maternal love is so deep that it will brave death to protect its offspring.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.name: Ribombee
data.flavorText: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.

abilities.name: Curative Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.

attacks.name: Dragon's Wish
attacks.text: During your next turn, you may attach any number of Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon.

data.name: Spearow
data.flavorText: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.

attacks.name: Peck Bugs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Granbull
data.flavorText: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Fight Back
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Dratini, a Dragonair, and a Dragonite, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Fearow
data.flavorText: Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can be seen in murals from deep in ancient history.

attacks.name: Devastating Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 3 cards.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Tauros-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mad Bull-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.name: Spinda
data.flavorText: Its steps are staggering and unsteady, but Spinda thinks it's walking in a straight line.

attacks.name: Teeter Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: Because it doesn't yelp, it's extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.name: Stoutland
data.flavorText: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, it's a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.

attacks.name: Ferocious Bellow
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Herdier
data.flavorText: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed make this a troublesome Pokémon to train.

abilities.name: Treasure Hunt
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Pikipek
data.flavorText: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Trumbeak
data.flavorText: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of call and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Yungoos
data.flavorText: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.

data.name: Toucannon
data.flavorText: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Beak Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Bewear
data.flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

attacks.name: Bear Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Gumshoos-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Search the Premises
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

attacks.name: Gumshoe Chance-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

abilities.name: Instruct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Big Malasada
rules: Heal 20 damage and remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Crushing Hammer
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card from that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ilima
rules: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and flips a coin. If heads, that player draws 6 cards. If tails, they draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hau
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Nest Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Kukui
rules: Draw 2 cards. During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Poison Barb
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Repel
rules: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Skull Grunt
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 Energy cards from it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lurantis-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flower Supply
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Solar Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chloroscythe-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

data.name: Lapras-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Ice Beam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Espeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Divide-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lillie
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Skull Grunt
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 Energy cards from it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rotom Dex
rules: After counting your Prize cards, shuffle them into your deck. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Timer Ball
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for an Evolution Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lunala-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moongeist Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunar Fall-GX
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Solgaleo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mad Bull-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Kukui
rules: Draw 2 cards. During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Umbreon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Call-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Gumshoos-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Divide-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
